name: Risk Assessment Framework
description: Systematically identify, analyze, and evaluate potential risks before making decisions or taking actions. Critical for risk management and strategic planning.

structure.name: Risk Identification
structure.description: Brainstorm all potential risks that could affect the decision/project

structure.name: Risk Categorization
structure.description: Classify risks by type (financial, operational, technical, etc.)

structure.name: Probability Analysis
structure.description: Assess likelihood of each risk occurring (low/medium/high or 1-10 scale)

structure.name: Impact Assessment
structure.description: Evaluate potential consequences if risks materialize

structure.name: Risk Prioritization
structure.description: Create risk matrix to prioritize most significant risks

structure.name: Mitigation Planning
structure.description: Develop strategies to prevent or reduce high-priority risks

structure.name: Contingency Planning
structure.description: Plan backup actions for risks that cannot be prevented

prompts: What could go wrong with this decision/project? List all possible risks.
How likely is each risk to occur? Use a 1-10 scale or low/medium/high.
What would be the impact if each risk happened? Consider financial, operational, reputational impacts.
Which risks are most critical? (High probability + High impact)
How can we prevent or reduce the most critical risks?
What backup plans do we need if risks still occur?
What monitoring systems do we need to track risks?
when_to_use: Before making major business decisions or investments
When planning new projects or initiatives
When entering new markets or launching products
When considering significant changes to operations
For regulatory compliance and safety planning
When stakeholder risk tolerance is low
when_not_to_use: For minor decisions with minimal consequences
When quick action is required and time doesn't permit analysis
When risks are well-known and already managed
When decision-making culture accepts high uncertainty

examples.title: Product Launch Risk Assessment
examples.description: Before launching new software, identified risks: technical bugs, market rejection, competitive response, regulatory issues. Created mitigation strategies for each high-priority risk.

examples.title: Supply Chain Risk Analysis
examples.description: Manufacturing company assessed supplier risks: single-source dependency, geopolitical factors, quality control. Developed alternative suppliers and inventory buffers.

metadata.author: Risk Management professionals, based on ISO 31000 standards

validation_status.validation_notes: Essential risk management framework applicable across domains
